intro: Xanthisma restiforme, commonly known as the slender sandreed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Xanthisma restiforme plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
